text: I'm a freelance compositor, I tend to work around the London studios across mainly TV/Advertising. It sounds like production side would be a great route for you then. I understand you have mixed interests and production being a varied role may be the right way to go. Your artist knowledge and experience will also come in handy within a production role and is a desirable skill.

I think production is a very interesting role, if I had to pick another career I think i would also go into production as it is so varied and exciting. You get to be involved in the creation of a film from the beginning through to completion. With opportunities to work on set, recruitment, in VFX houses, agencies and working with directors/supervisors.

You did mention that you may be raising a family in the coming years and I also think production could be a good job to work while also maintaining family responsibilities. With a high representation of women in the production industry the understanding regarding parenting responsibilities should also be well established.
